result.execSummary:
All charges against Todd Aaron Hutchison in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Todd Aaron Hutchison is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd Aaron Hutchison

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  10:01 a.m. 
INCLUDES 20CF111, 22CF497 and 20TR408.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Dennis Melowski. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding. 

20CF111>>>
State moves to DISMISS Count 2 (Operating w/PAC 5th); COURT grants.  

20TR408>>>
State moves to find Count 1 (Refusal) as deemed lawful; COURT grants. 

22CF497>>>
State moves to DISMISS Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants. 

PLEA: 

20CF111>>Count 1 (OWI 5th): GUILTY.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: I/S 3 years prison (1 year IC/2 year ES) for 3 years probation.  CONDITIONS:  6 months MCJ with huber for work/treatment or EMP if eligible; (COURT grants 1 day credit).  Any vehicle titled or registered in the Defendant's name is subject to IID installation for 24 months.  24 months DL revocation with any administrative credit.  AODA and follow up.  Maintain FTW/School/treatment or combination of at least 30 hours, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores or beer tents.  $600 fine plus court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.   Defendant is eligible for CIP/SAP. 

Adj:  10:19 a.m.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:27 pm 
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett; Defendant does NOT appear - Atty Dennis Melowski appears by Zoom Video on deft's behalf. 
Date and time was set for initial appearance. 
Atty Melowski requests opportunity to reach his client by phone. 
OTR: 2:28 pm BOTR: 2:45 pm 
Atty Melowski notes he was unable to reach his client and advises he may have had a miscommunication with his client regarding today's date. 
CC set for 5/11/2022 at 8:05 am with JA in Br. 4 - deft to appear. 
Adj: 2:48 pm
